The Washington track and field team had just one runner compete at the NCAA Outdoor Track and Field Championships on Friday in Eugene Ore. and the result was not one it was hoping for PERIOD

Junior Izaic Yorks the Pac12 1500meter champion got a chance to put a stamp on a very solid season but an injury suffered Wednesday derailed his chances at the worst possible time PERIOD

The Lakewood Wash. native suffered a foot injury after being tripped during Wednesdays qualifying and couldnt overcome it finishing in thirteenth place in the 1500meter final with a time of . pERIOD

He honestly wasnt sure hed be able to run head coach Greg Metcalf said PERIOD  .. PERIOD If the race wouldve been yesterday he would not have been able to run. metcalf said Yorks did not let the injury stop him from putting forth his full effort and commended the way he battled during the race PERIOD

He put himself in a great place to win with  meters to go Metcalf said PERIOD By the end I think he just ran out of steam PERIOD .. PERIOD I think he learned a lot from this race and Im still really proud of Izaic. the fourday national championships conclude Saturday PERIOD Sophomore Maddie Meyers will be the lone UW athlete in action competing in the womens 5000meter run PERIOD

Reach reporter Shane Lantz at sportsdailyuw.com PERIOD Twitter ShaneLantz93
